features: 【Wrinkle Free】 This steamer has the power to get just about any steaming job done. It has 800-Watts of power which provide steam hot enough to soften and remove the wrinkles quiackly.

【Easy to Use】The travel steamer has a 150ml water tank, this unit can easily come to high temperature in short time and be ready to steam clothing to a wrinkle-free look. it is extremely easy to use and very durable.

【 Wide range of applications】 This steamer creates strong penetrating steam and can be used for a wide range of fabrics. Steamer makes getting stubborn wrinkles out of clothing including table cloths, curtains, and bedding and so on. it was very efficient and did a great job getting the wrinkles out.

【Extra-long power cable】The handheld steamer is easy to move around with 8ft extra long cord . You can use it anywhere, without limitation of space. Every single steamer cable is rigorously tested for maximum safety and durability.

【Perfect for Travel】 This compact travel steamer is lightweight and easy to move. This steamer can not only be used in the home but also can be used on vacation or on a business trip. This steamer is a good choice as a gift for family and friends.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Makes wrinkles gone instantly Our handheld steamer for clothes is designed for ease of use . This steamer creates strong and powerful penetrating steam . it was very efficient and did a great job getting the wrinkles out

Powerful Steam Output It’s so compact, and only has a 150ml water tank, this unit can easily come to temperature in short time and be ready to steam clothing to a wrinkle-free look. it is extremely easy-to-use and very durable.

Handled Travel Steamer Because it has a compact design. This product can not only be used in the home but can be used while on vacation or while on a business trip. Please use a transformer which can convert voltage to 110V when using this steamer abroad.
Works great with a variety of fabrics This steamer creates strong penetrating steam and can be used for a wide range of fabrics. The Steamer is gentle enough to handle delicates, silk, wools etc.
Auto-shutoff It also has an auto-shutoff feature that shuts the unit off if it becomes too heated or if its left unattended for 8-minutes. Since it has a compact design.

Use Distilled Water The first thing you’re going to want to do is to add water to your steamer. If at all possible, you should try to use water that isn’t too hard as the calcium may end up clogging your steam machine and lessening your machine’s life. Please use distilled water.Make sure that before you add the water the machine is properly assembled, and make sure that you don’t overfill the machine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well, good small size for travel
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I have some more delicate blouses and things that I prefer to avoid ironing–and sometimes in general I just prefer not to have to pull out my ironing board, so I thought it was about time to try out a fabric steamer and ordered this one.The steamer is a conveniently small size, and has a nice long electrical cord (about 91 inches according to my measurements). There is a gasket in the nozzle, and they’ve also included an extra gasket in case the first one wears out. It’s easy to fill since you just have to unlock the spout at the top and pour the water in. It’s also really lightweight so it shouldn’t be burdensome to add to my luggage, though of course its shape might prove a little awkward.For my first test I steamed a blouse that I made the mistake of storing folded in my dresser, which left it very wrinkly. I used distilled water to avoid any risk of mineral deposits steaming onto my clothes. The on/off switch is right on the handle and it started steaming pretty quickly after turning it on. The steam was very effective at removing the wrinkles from my clothes. I’ve included a video of the process and the only issue I ran into was because I had it hanging off the back of my office chair; I hit an area where part of the chair sticks out and it prevented the steam from doing its magic. Otherwise, I didn’t have to do anything but run the steamer nozzle over the fabric and the wrinkles relaxed right out.I didn’t quite fill the reservoir and ended up having just enough water to fully unwrinkle my blouse. I imagine future uses might prove to be a little faster since I won’t be trying to film it at the same time and I’ll have a better idea of what to do.Bear in mind that since this is steam, you will need to let the nozzle cool off before you try to remove it if you need to refill it. If you want to be able to work continuously on a large number of items you might want to look for something with a higher capacity. If you need something that can do furniture and clothes steaming you’ll probably need something that’s more specifically designed for that, both because this one needs to be held at specific angles and is only designed to hold a relatively small amount of water.This will be helpful to have on hand for when I have just one thing I need to freshen up before wearing. Where it will be safe to do so I may experiment with trying to lift stains from certain things as well (bearing in mind that the steamer shouldn’t be held at more than a 45 degree angle). Since it’s so nice and small, I could also see myself packing this for trips within the US so that I can freshen up my clothes after getting them out of a suitcase or duffel bag.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works pretty well if you keep your expecatations reasonable
reviews.reviewText: I primarily use a large standing steamer for my clothes, but it's so big and bulky that I wanted an alternative for shirts that just need a quick touch up from being too tightly wedged against something else in the closet. This works really well for that. It heated up in a little over a minute and I was able to quickly steam out a few stray wrinkles from a shirt that came out of the dryer less than smooth. I did find I had to be very careful about keeping it moving. Unlike my large steamer I could not start at the top and work down in straight lines as the design for the steam holes left clear marks down the shirt if you got too close. I basically traded unorganized wrinkles for very organized ones. I found working in a circular motion and moving constantly worked best but it also slowed down the process a bit and is counter intuitive to how you want to work from side to side. Overall you get what you pay for and after getting the technique down it will be fine for a quick job. It is small enough to easily travel with as well. It is going to be rough if you have a bigger surface area to cover or more set in wrinkles but if you keep in mind it is not really designed for heavy lifting jobs then it's a good option.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars small but mighty
reviews.reviewText: I had my doubts whether this product would deliver, but it did. Getting started is easy:Unscrew the topFill with water to the max lineScrew but onTurn onWait about 1 minute until the water is boiling and steam begins to pour out of the spoutNote that one will have to keep the product plugged in while using it, but the cord is long enough to allow working standing up and moving back and forth.I had a few clothes I wear to the office I needed to unwrinkle and the little steamer worked well for over an hour.With the size of this product being fairly small, it gets about 1 piece completed. Then one has to refill the water.I used an oven mit to unscrew the top of the steamer in between garments because the top gets very warm and I did not want to risk burning my hands.I think my working with this product for about an hour uninterrupted gave it a pretty good stress test and proved that it can hold up to longer jobs.Granted, I got a bit irritated that I had to refill the product several times, but with the size being more of a “travel” steamer, I am not deducting starts for that.The product did a fantastic job getting the wrinkles out and is very easy to use. I recommend this for anybody who wants an affordable garment steamer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I am really enjoying this steamer. It is small, compact, easy to use, and quick to set up. I like that you can fill it up with water and within minutes have it working. It takes up less space than setting up an ironing board and a traditional iron. Each fill of the steamer does one to two garments depending how wrinkled they are. Perfect size to take with you when traveling. I agree with other reviewers that you need to be careful taking the top off or putting you hand near the steam holes. I would recommend getting a hand mitt to protect your fingers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for on the road
reviews.reviewText: I needed a portable steamer for when I’m out on the road (which I am out a lot). It conveniently fits in my travel tote bags without taking up so much space. Easy to turn on and use and it’s very effective. Just what I needed 👍🏾
